common.text: Which compliance test do you want to take?

questions.question: Does our company have a formal HIPAA compliance policy that is regularly reviewed and updated?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain current policy review and update schedule.
Develop and implement a formal HIPAA compliance policy.

questions.question: Do we conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential HIPAA compliance gaps?

response_options.recommendation: Continue conducting regular risk assessments.
Conduct regular risk assessments (e.g., annually) to identify vulnerabilities and gaps in HIPAA compliance.

questions.question: Are all employees required to complete HIPAA training on handling Protected Health Information (PHI)?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain mandatory HIPAA training for all employees who handle PHI.
Implement mandatory HIPAA training for all employees who handle PHI.

questions.question: Do we have strict access control policies to ensure only authorized personnel can access PHI?

response_options.recommendation: Continue to enforce strict access control policies.
Develop and enforce strict access control policies. Use the principle of least privilege. Implement multi-factor authentication where appropriate.

questions.question: Is PHI encrypted both in transit and at rest to prevent unauthorized access?

response_options.recommendation: Continue to encrypt PHI both in transit and at rest.
Implement encryption for PHI both in transit and at rest.

questions.question: Do we have a documented and tested incident response plan for handling PHI breaches?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain the documented and tested incident response plan.
Develop a comprehensive incident response plan.

questions.question: Are third-party vendors and business associates required to sign a Business Associate Agreement (BAA) before handling PHI?

response_options.recommendation: Ensure BAAs are current and enforced with all third-party vendors and business associates.
Ensure that BAAs are in place with all third-party vendors and business associates before they handle PHI.

questions.question: Does our company have a process to handle patient requests for access, correction, and deletion of their PHI?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain the documented process for handling patient requests.
Establish a documented process to handle patient requests for access, correction, and deletion of PHI in accordance with HIPAA regulations.

questions.question: Do we regularly conduct internal audits to ensure ongoing HIPAA compliance?

response_options.recommendation: Continue regular internal audits. Document audit findings and corrective actions.
Conduct regular internal audits to monitor HIPAA compliance. Document audit findings and corrective actions.

questions.question: Is there a designated HIPAA Compliance Officer responsible for overseeing compliance efforts?

response_options.recommendation: Ensure the HIPAA Compliance Officer has the resources and authority to perform their duties.
Appoint a HIPAA Compliance Officer to oversee and manage HIPAA compliance efforts.

questions.question: Does our company have formally documented policies to ensure compliance with SOC 2 Trust Service Criteria?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain and regularly review documented policies and procedures for SOC 2 compliance.
Develop and document policies and procedures that address the relevant SOC 2 Trust Services Criteria.

questions.question: Do we conduct regular risk assessments to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities in our systems?

response_options.recommendation: Continue regular risk assessments.
Perform regular risk assessments to identify and mitigate security vulnerabilities.

questions.question: Are access controls in place to restrict unauthorized access to sensitive data and critical systems?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain and enforce access controls.
Implement and enforce access controls based on the principle of least privilege.

questions.question: Does our organization encrypt sensitive customer data both in transit and at rest?

response_options.recommendation: Continue to encrypt sensitive customer data.
Encrypt sensitive customer data both in transit and at rest.

questions.question: Do we have an incident response plan that is documented, tested, and updated regularly?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain, test, and update the incident response plan regularly.
Develop, document, test, and regularly update an incident response plan to address security incidents.

questions.question: Are all employees required to undergo security awareness training on SOC 2 policies and best practices?

response_options.recommendation: Continue providing regular security awareness training.
Provide regular security awareness training to all employees, covering SOC 2 policies and best practices.

questions.question: Do we have system monitoring and logging mechanisms in place to detect and respond to security incidents?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain system monitoring and logging.
Implement system monitoring and logging to detect and respond to security incidents. Retain logs for an appropriate period.

questions.question: Do we ensure that third-party vendors handling our customer data comply with SOC 2 security requirements?

response_options.recommendation: Continue to ensure third-party vendor compliance.
Ensure third-party vendors comply with SOC 2 security requirements. Include SOC 2 requirements in vendor contracts and perform due diligence.

questions.question: Is our disaster recovery and business continuity plan tested periodically to ensure operational resilience?

response_options.recommendation: Continue to test and maintain the disaster recovery and business continuity plan.
Develop, test, and maintain a disaster recovery and business continuity plan to ensure operational resilience.

questions.question: Do we conduct regular internal audits and assessments to verify our compliance with SOC 2 requirements?

response_options.recommendation: Continue regular internal audits and assessments.
Conduct regular internal audits and assessments to verify compliance with SOC 2 requirements.

questions.question: Has our company implemented the five core functions of the NIST Cybersecurity Framework: Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, and Recover?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain implementation of the five core functions.
Implement the five core functions of the NIST Cybersecurity Framework (Identify, Protect, Detect, Respond, Recover) to manage cybersecurity risk.

questions.question: Do we conduct regular risk assessments to identify and mitigate cybersecurity threats as per NIST guidelines?

response_options.recommendation: Continue regular risk assessments following NIST guidelines.
Conduct regular risk assessments following NIST guidelines to identify and mitigate cybersecurity threats.

questions.question: Have we adopted the security and privacy controls outlined in NIST SP 800-53 for our information systems?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain adoption and implementation of NIST SP 800-53 controls.
Adopt and implement the appropriate security and privacy controls from NIST SP 800-53 based on risk assessment.

questions.question: Does our company enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) to protect sensitive data in compliance with NIST 800-171?

response_options.recommendation: Continue enforcing multi-factor authentication.
Enforce multi-factor authentication (MFA) for access to sensitive data and systems, as recommended by NIST 800-171.

questions.question: Are all employees trained on NIST cybersecurity policies and best practices on a regular basis?

response_options.recommendation: Continue providing regular training.
Provide regular training to employees on NIST cybersecurity policies and best practices.

questions.question: Do we ensure that all sensitive data is encrypted both in transit and at rest according to NIST standards?

response_options.recommendation: Continue ensuring data encryption.
Ensure sensitive data is encrypted both in transit and at rest, in accordance with NIST standards.

questions.question: Has our company implemented continuous monitoring and threat detection mechanisms as per NIST guidelines?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain continuous monitoring and threat detection.
Implement continuous monitoring and threat detection mechanisms to identify and respond to cybersecurity threats.

questions.question: Are our third-party vendors required to comply with NIST security standards before accessing company data?

response_options.recommendation: Continue to require third-party vendor compliance.
Require third-party vendors to comply with relevant NIST security standards before granting access to company data.

questions.question: Do we have an incident response plan that is tested and updated regularly as per NIST recommendations?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain, test, and update the incident response plan regularly.
Develop, test, and regularly update an incident response plan based on NIST recommendations.

questions.question: Does our organization align NIST compliance with other regulatory requirements like SOC 2, HIPAA, or GDPR?

response_options.recommendation: Continue aligning NIST compliance with other regulatory requirements.
Align NIST compliance efforts with other relevant regulatory requirements (e.g., SOC 2, HIPAA, GDPR) to ensure a holistic approach to security and compliance.

questions.question: Has top management formally approved an Information Security Policy aligned with ISO 27001?

response_options.recommendation: Continue periodic reviews and ensure the policy is communicated across the organization.
Schedule an urgent meeting with executives to develop or update the Information Security Policy, obtain formal approval, and launch a training program.
Identify missing elements and work with leadership to revise and fully endorse the policy.

questions.question: Do we conduct regular risk assessments to identify, analyze, and mitigate security threats?

response_options.recommendation: Verify that risk assessments are documented, updated, and that corrective actions are tracked.
Implement a structured risk management program based on ISO 27005 guidelines, conduct a gap analysis, assign risk owners, and schedule recurring assessments.

questions.question: Are access permissions reviewed periodically to ensure only authorized personnel can access critical systems and data?

response_options.recommendation: Review access permissions regularly to ensure only authorized personnel have access.
Review and update access permissions immediately; restrict access to critical systems.
Assess current permissions and enforce stricter controls where necessary.

questions.question: Do we have a documented incident response plan that is tested and updated regularly?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain the incident response plan by scheduling regular drills and updating it as new threats emerge.
Develop a formal incident response plan following industry best practices, define roles and protocols, and conduct simulations immediately.
Audit existing procedures to identify missing elements and enhance the plan with complete detection, containment, and recovery steps.

questions.question: Do all employees receive regular security awareness training on ISO 27001 policies and best practices?

response_options.recommendation: Ensure continuous training and periodic refresher courses are in place.
Implement a mandatory security training program for all employees.

questions.question: Is sensitive data encrypted both in transit and at rest, with a structured key management process in place?

response_options.recommendation: Continue using encryption and key management best practices.
Implement encryption for data at rest and in transit along with a structured key management process immediately.
Review current encryption practices and address any gaps in key management.

questions.question: Do we have a disaster recovery and business continuity plan that is tested periodically?

response_options.recommendation: Regularly test the continuity plan and update recovery objectives based on business impact analysis.
Develop a comprehensive disaster recovery and business continuity plan immediately, and schedule regular tests.
Accelerate development by dedicating resources, setting deadlines, and test immediately upon completion.

questions.question: Are suppliers and third-party vendors required to comply with our security policies and undergo security assessments?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain ongoing vendor reviews, verify compliance certifications, and update contractual obligations regularly.
Establish a vendor compliance program with enforced security agreements and periodic audits.

questions.question: Do we conduct regular internal audits and management reviews to ensure ongoing ISO 27001 compliance?

response_options.recommendation: Continue regular internal audits and management reviews to ensure ongoing compliance.
Implement a scheduled internal audit program and review compliance procedures immediately.
Identify gaps in the audit process and strengthen internal reviews.

questions.question: Do we have a process to monitor, measure, and continuously improve our Information Security Management System (ISMS)?

response_options.recommendation: Continue monitoring and improving your ISMS through regular reviews.
Establish a process for continuous monitoring and improvement of your ISMS immediately.
Monitor progress and complete the improvement process as soon as possible.

questions.question: Do we have a valid legal basis (e.g., consent, contract, legitimate interest) for collecting and processing personal data?

response_options.recommendation: Ensure all data processing activities are documented with a valid legal basis and review regularly.
Review data processing operations and implement mechanisms to obtain explicit consent or valid legal basis immediately.
Audit current practices and update documentation and consent mechanisms to fully comply.

questions.question: Do we obtain clear, informed, and freely given consent before collecting personal data?

response_options.recommendation: Continue obtaining clear and informed consent from users.
Implement clear consent mechanisms and update data collection processes to ensure informed consent.

questions.question: Do we have a process to handle requests for access, rectification, deletion, and portability of personal data?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain and periodically test your DSAR process to ensure timely responses.
Develop a formal process for handling data subject requests and train staff accordingly.
Identify and address gaps in your DSAR process.

questions.question: Are encryption, access controls, and pseudonymization applied to protect personal data?

response_options.recommendation: Keep current security measures and conduct regular audits.
Implement robust encryption, access controls, and pseudonymization immediately.
Review and enhance security measures to fully protect personal data.

questions.question: Do we have a process to detect, assess and report data breaches to authorities within 72 hours?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain the breach notification process with regular simulations.
Develop a comprehensive breach notification process and train staff to comply with the 72-hour rule.

questions.question: Are all cross-border data transfers protected using GDPR-approved safeguards like SCCs, BCRs or adequacy decisions?

response_options.recommendation: Ensure all international data transfers are secure and meet GDPR standards.
Implement proper safeguards for international data transfers immediately.
No action needed if no cross-border transfers occur.

questions.question: Is our privacy policy clear, up-to-date, and accessible, informing users about how we collect and process their data?

response_options.recommendation: Continue updating the privacy policy and ensure its accessibility.
Redraft your privacy policy to meet GDPR transparency requirements and republish immediately.
Identify missing details, update the policy, and gather feedback to ensure clarity.

questions.question: Do we conduct regular audits and assessments to ensure continuous GDPR compliance?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain regular GDPR audits and compliance reviews.
Establish a schedule for regular GDPR audits and update practices as needed.

questions.question: Have we implemented and maintained firewalls and secure configurations for all systems?

response_options.recommendation: Continue maintaining firewalls and secure configurations.
Implement firewalls and secure configurations immediately.
Review and strengthen network security measures.

questions.question: Is all stored cardholder data encrypted, masked, or protected according to PCI DSS guidelines?

response_options.recommendation: Keep encrypting and protecting stored card data; perform regular audits.
Immediately implement encryption, masking, and protection measures; consult a QSA for a gap analysis.
Audit your data storage practices to verify compliance.

questions.question: Do we encrypt payment card data when transmitted over public networks?

response_options.recommendation: Continue using TLS/SSL for secure transmission.
Implement TLS/SSL encryption for all public network transmissions immediately.

questions.question: Are all systems protected against malware, regularly updated, and securely patched?

response_options.recommendation: Continue updating systems and performing regular vulnerability scans.
Implement patch management and vulnerability scanning immediately.
Review and update systems to fix vulnerabilities.

questions.question: Do we enforce strict access control measures, ensuring that only authorized personnel can access cardholder data?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain strict access controls and review user permissions periodically.
Implement strict access controls immediately, including RBAC and MFA.

questions.question: Is multi-factor authentication (MFA) enabled for all administrative and remote access accounts?

response_options.recommendation: Continue using MFA for critical access.
Implement MFA for all administrative and remote access accounts immediately.
Review and enhance current authentication measures to include full MFA.

questions.question: Do we regularly monitor and test networks, including logging, intrusion detection, and penetration testing?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain regular network monitoring and testing; update configurations as needed.
Establish comprehensive monitoring and testing processes immediately.
Complete the implementation of network monitoring and testing as soon as possible.

questions.question: Do all employees handling cardholder data receive regular security awareness training?

response_options.recommendation: Continue regular security training and refreshers.
Implement mandatory security awareness training immediately.

questions.question: Do we have a documented incident response plan that is tested and updated regularly? (PCI)

response_options.recommendation: Continue testing and updating the incident response plan; document incidents for improvement.
Develop and implement a comprehensive incident response plan immediately.
Review current incident response procedures and develop a full plan if needed.

questions.question: Do all vendors and service providers handling cardholder data comply with PCI DSS and provide proof of compliance?

response_options.recommendation: Maintain ongoing vendor compliance checks and review AOCs periodically.
Establish a vendor compliance program, require immediate submission of AOCs, and conduct assessments.
Identify non-compliant vendors, work with them on remediation, and enforce regular compliance reporting.

questions.question: Do we have a process to monitor, measure, and continuously improve our Information Security Management System (ISMS)?

response_options.recommendation: Continue monitoring and improving your ISMS through regular reviews.
Establish a process for continuous monitoring and improvement of your ISMS immediately.
Monitor progress and complete the improvement process as soon as possible.
